intro_p1: We attach great importance to the protection of user information and will diligently and prudently protect the security of user information. When you register, log in, and use (hereinafter collectively referred to as "Use") the website and the client applications and applications provided from time to time (the aforementioned website, client applications and applications are collectively referred to as "Platform") and related products, services, and solutions ("Services"), the information you actively provide, and the information we collect through automated means during your use of the platform and related services, is called "User Information", including but not limited to the personal information you provide to the platform. We will collect, use, store, transfer, and protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant provisions of this privacy policy. We hope to introduce to you through this privacy policy how we process your personal information, so we recommend that you read and understand all the contents of this privacy policy carefully and completely. Among them, the terms that limit and exempt liability are highlighted in bold to draw your attention. Please read them carefully.
intro_p2: If you do not agree to this privacy policy, we cannot provide you with complete services, and you should immediately stop using the platform and related services. When you choose to use the platform and related services, it will be deemed that you accept and recognize our processing of your relevant information in accordance with this privacy policy.
intro_p3: This policy applies to visitors (hereinafter collectively referred to as "Developers") who visit, register, and log in to the platform for activities within the platform.
intro_p4: If you use the platform and services to create and publish Agents (intelligent agents), applications, and workflows for use by other users within the platform or external platform users (collectively referred to as "End Users"), or integrate services within the platform into your own other applications, then you shall provide services to end users in your own name and act as the personal information processor for the personal information of end users at this stage, and our relationship with you at this stage is subject to the i Data Processing Agreement.
intro_p5: This privacy policy will help you understand:
toc_item_1: I. How we collect and use personal information
toc_item_2: II. Use of Cookies and similar technologies
toc_item_3: III. How we store personal information
toc_item_4: IV. Partners involved in data use and transfer, disclosure of personal information
toc_item_5: V. How we protect user information security
toc_item_8: VIII. Terms of use by minors
toc_item_9: IX. Revision and notification of privacy policy
section1_title: I. How we collect and use personal information
section1_subtitle: Personal information we directly collect and use
section1_p1: We will collect user information that you actively provide when using the platform and related services in the following scenarios and business activities, as well as user information generated during your use of the platform and related services that we collect through automated means, including but not limited to the personal information you provide to the platform.
section1_p2: Please note specially that if information cannot identify your personal identity alone or in combination with other information and is unrelated to you, it does not belong to your personal information in the legal sense; when your information can identify your personal identity alone or in combination with other information or is related to you, or when we combine data that cannot be linked to any specific personal information with your other personal information, then during the combined use period, this information will be processed and protected as your personal information in accordance with this privacy policy. To be clear, personal information does not include information that has been anonymized.
section1_1_p1: For the purpose of platform operation, we will obtain your account information when you log in and use related services, including your avatar, nickname, account ID, registered mobile phone number, and authentication information.
section1_2_p1: (1) We are committed to providing you with safe and reliable products and usage environments. Providing high-quality and reliable services and information is our core goal. To maintain the normal operation of our services and protect the legitimate interests of you or other users or the public from loss, we will collect necessary information for maintaining the safe and stable operation of products or services, including device model, device brand, operating system, and system language.
section1_2_p2: (2) When you browse or use the platform, to ensure the normal operation and operational security of the website and services, prevent network attacks and intrusion risks, and more accurately identify violations of laws and regulations or relevant agreements and service rules, we will collect your operating system type and operating system version number, IP address, browser type and browser version, time zone and language and other device information, and web browsing records. If you use the mobile client application we provide, we will also collect the following information: device identifiers (Android such as AndroidID, OAID; iOS such as IDFV, IDFA. Different identifiers will differ in validity period, whether they can be reset by users, and how they are obtained), IP address, SIM (mcc, mnc), WLAN access points (such as SSID, BSSID), Bluetooth, base stations, software version number, network access method/type/status, network quality data, operation/use/service logs, and device sensor data (such as accelerometer sensors, gyroscope sensors, game action sensors). Please understand that this information is basic information that we must collect to provide services and ensure the normal operation of services and network security.
section1_2_p3: (3) To help us better understand the operation of related services, and to prevent malicious programs and ensure the quality and efficiency of operations, we may record network log information, collect information about running processes, as well as the frequency of using the platform and related services, crash data, usage conditions, and related performance data information.
section1_3_p1: To provide you with services, we collect the following information in the following specific scenarios:
section1_3_p2: (1) When you use functions to create/publish intelligent agents, workflows, web/mobile applications, and skills, or use the intelligent agent services officially provided by the platform, for the purpose of providing corresponding services, the system needs to collect the content you upload/input, operation and interaction records, and the intelligent agents, workflow templates, web/mobile applications, and skill information created/published using the aforementioned functions.
section1_3_p3: (2) The following is a separate description of your use of the Agent (intelligent agent) service:
section1_3_p4: If you assign tasks to the officially provided AI Agent (intelligent agent), the system's AI Agent (intelligent agent) will automatically break down, plan, and execute the tasks you assign, completing various tasks from information inquiry to project plan formulation. During this process, you will actively input your instructions to the platform, and you can also upload and add [files, text, skills, MCP extensions, images, etc. (specific to the functions of the system); if you add your customized and/or MCP extensions in the platform's MCP extension library, during task execution, the intelligent agent will provide request information to the MCP extension service provider you choose in accordance with the interface specifications defined by the MCP extension, and obtain the returned data to execute the task. If the API interface required to be accessed by the skill you configured requires access credentials, you need to fill in the API access credential information according to the page prompts when configuring the skill. Please rest assured that the platform will only call the credential according to the settings of the skill developer when the task execution needs to call the current skill to execute the skill operation. You can view the details of ongoing and completed tasks through the task list (including the task instructions you input, task topic, task execution process, and task results). At the same time, the platform will automatically collect your operation logs, usage duration, and error logs during your use of the system.
section1_3_p5: Permission application and management. To ensure the normal operation of "system" functions, we may apply for access to some system permissions on your mobile device. These permissions will not be enabled by default, and will only be used when implementing related functions after obtaining your explicit authorization. You can enable or disable related permissions in the settings function of your device. After withdrawing authorization, we will no longer collect information related to that permission, but this will not affect our personal information processing previously carried out based on your authorization.
section1_3_p6: (3) When you browse the system, the system will record your browsing and usage. If you have not logged in to your account, the system will record your browsing, clicking, favorites, and other operation behavior information through the identifier information corresponding to your device. If you have logged in to your account, the system will record your browsing, clicking, downloading, sharing, following, liking (favorites), favorites, comments, and other operation behavior information through your account.
section1_3_p7: (4) Image service. When you upload images through the system, you can input instructions, and the AI model will recognize, interpret, or perform other operations on the images according to your instructions. To achieve the aforementioned purpose, the system will request authorization for "read and write photo library" permission from you.
section1_3_p8: (5) Search and browsing services. The system can provide search results displaying third-party websites (including websites created for you by intelligent agents under specific tasks, the same below) and services for browsing third-party websites. Third-party websites will provide you with specific services, and these third-party websites may need to call system sensitive permissions.
section1_3_p9: (6) Sharing. In situations where you share or receive shared information, we need to access your clipboard to read the passwords and links contained therein to implement functions or services such as jumping and sharing.
section1_4_title: 1.4 User consultation, fault reporting, and troubleshooting information
section1_4_p1: We may collect user consultation records, fault reporting records, and troubleshooting processes for user faults (such as communication or call records) generated when you use the system and related services. We will record and analyze this information to respond to your help requests more timely and to improve services.
section1_5_title: 1.5 How we use your contact information
section1_5_p1: You acknowledge and agree that for the contact information (i.e., contact phone number) you provide during your use of products and/or services, we may send notifications to one or more of them during operations for purposes such as user message notification, identity verification, security verification, and user experience research; in addition, we may also provide you with commercial information through SMS and phone calls to the mobile phone numbers collected in the aforementioned process, but please rest assured that if you do not wish to receive this information, you can unsubscribe through the unsubscribe method provided in the mobile phone SMS, or you can directly contact us to unsubscribe.
section1_6_p1: When you use the system's subscription services, skills, and module libraries, you can publish paid skills and templates to obtain skill and template revenue, or you can purchase subscription services, skills, and paid templates. At that time, you need to provide information necessary for receiving and making payments, including but not limited to your name, personal identification code (such as ID number), bank card information, and mobile phone number.
section1_6_p2: When we use information for other purposes not stated in this policy, or when we use information collected for specific purposes for other purposes, we will seek your consent in advance.
section1_7_p1: When you use this service, on the premise of processing through secure encryption technology, strict de-identification, and inability to re-identify specific individuals, we may evaluate, analyze, and use the data collected by the service and the replies generated by AI for model training to continuously adjust and optimize model effects and product experience.
section2_subtitle: Personal information we may obtain from third parties
section2_third_party_p1: To provide you with better and superior services, or to jointly provide services to you, or to prevent internet fraud, our affiliated companies and partners may share your personal information with us in accordance with legal provisions or your agreement or with your consent. We will adopt industry-standard practices and make the greatest commercial efforts to protect the security of your personal information in accordance with relevant laws and regulations and/or as required by the identity authentication function.
section3_subtitle: Handling of changes in the purpose of collecting and using personal information
section3_p1: Please understand that with the development of our business, the functions or services we provide may be adjusted and changed. In principle, when new functions or services are related to the functions or services we currently provide, the collection and use of personal information will have a direct or reasonable connection with the original processing purpose. In scenarios where there is no direct or reasonable connection with the original processing purpose, when we collect and use your personal information, we will again inform and explain to you through page prompts, interactive processes, and agreement confirmation methods in accordance with the requirements of laws and regulations and national standards, and obtain your consent.
section4_p1: Please understand that your developer data (including personal information involved therein) is different from the personal information described above, and the platform will process it as follows:
section4_1: 4.1 "Developer data" refers to: (1) all data uploaded when you use system functions/services to obtain or create Agents (intelligent agents), applications, and workflows (such as database information, plugins/API information uploaded by developers, audio, etc.), and (2) all data processed by the system during the operation period after you publish Agents (intelligent agents) and applications, including all text, sound, video or image files and software, and also includes data that developers can autonomously control and manage derived from your use of system products or services (such as configuration data, operation and maintenance data, etc.).
section4_2: 4.2 You fully own your developer data. As a neutral technical service provider, we will only strictly execute your instructions to process your developer data. Unless otherwise provided by laws and regulations, separately agreed based on specific product rules, or providing you with technical assistance to troubleshoot or solve technical problems based on your request, we will not access your developer data, nor will we make any unauthorized use or disclosure of your developer data.
section4_3: 4.3 You are responsible for the source and content of your developer data. We remind you to carefully judge the legality of the data source and content. You should guarantee that you have the right to use the platform and services to process such data, and that the aforementioned processing activities comply with the requirements of relevant laws and regulations, do not involve any illegal acts, infringements, or violations of contracts with third parties, and will not use the data for illegal purposes. All results and responsibilities caused by your developer data content and your data processing behavior violating laws and regulations, departmental rules, or national policies shall be borne by you yourself.
section4_4: 4.4 Subject to the preceding provisions, for any personal information contained in developer data, you shall, in accordance with the law, fulfill the obligation to inform relevant personal information subjects in advance and obtain the separate consent of relevant personal information subjects, and guarantee:
section4_4_dev_1: (1) Provide written explanation and confirmation on the source and legality of personal information in accordance with the method we require;
section4_4_dev_2: (2) When required by us, provide the scope of authorization and consent for personal information processing, including the purpose of use, and the personal information subject agrees to your use of the platform to process their personal information;
section4_4_dev_3: (3) If the personal information processing activities required for you to use the platform and related services exceed the scope of authorization and consent of such personal information, you shall be responsible for obtaining the express consent of the personal information subject within a reasonable period after providing the personal information or before we process the personal information, and provide written proof to us when required by us.
section4_4_dev_4: You understand and agree that unless the above conditions and other obligations required by law are met, you shall not provide developer data containing personal information to us. If you violate the above obligations, or fail to provide reasonably satisfactory proof to us as required, or we receive reports or complaints from personal information subjects, we have the right to unilaterally decide to refuse to transmit your relevant data (according to the actual situation, including by limiting relevant service functions, freezing, canceling or recovering accounts, etc.), or refuse to process relevant personal information and its related data in accordance with your instructions, and all responsibilities arising therefrom shall be borne by you.
section4_5: 4.5 You understand and agree that for your developer data, we provide you with a free data hosting service, but we have no obligation to store your data or information, nor are we responsible for your data storage work or results.
section2_title: II. Use of Cookies and similar technologies
section2_p1: Cookies and similar technologies are common and widely used technologies on the internet. When you use the platform, we may use related technologies to send one or more Cookies or anonymous identifiers to your device to collect and store your account information, search record information, and login status information. Cookies and similar technologies can help you skip the steps and processes of repeatedly filling in specific information and inputting search content, and can also help us improve service efficiency and enhance login and response speed.
section2_p2: You can refuse or manage Cookies through browser settings. However, please note that if you disable Cookies, you may not be able to enjoy the best service experience, and the availability of certain functions may be affected. We promise that we will not use your personal information collected through Cookies or similar technologies for any other purpose beyond those stated in this privacy policy.
section3_1_p1: In accordance with the provisions of laws and regulations, we will store your personal information collected and generated during domestic operations within the People's Republic of China. Currently, we will not transmit the above information overseas. If we transmit overseas, we will strictly comply with China's relevant laws and regulatory policies and will follow the provisions of relevant countries or seek your consent.
section3_2_1: 2.1 We will retain your personal information only for the period necessary to provide the platform and related services, but you understand and acknowledge that necessary storage periods may vary based on different services and their functional requirements. The criteria we use to determine the storage period include:
section3_2_1_1: (1) The time required to retain personal information to complete the business purpose, including providing services, maintaining corresponding transaction and business records according to legal requirements, ensuring the security of the system and services, and responding to possible user inquiries or complaints, problem positioning, etc.;
section3_2_1_2: (2) Longer retention periods agreed by users;
section3_2_1_3: (3) Special requirements of laws, contracts, etc. for retaining personal information.
section3_2_2: 2.2 During the period when you have not withdrawn your authorization consent, deleted or cancelled your account, we will retain relevant information. After the necessary period expires, we will delete or anonymize your information, unless otherwise provided by laws and regulations.
section4_title: IV. Partners involved in data use and transfer, disclosure of personal information
section4_1_1_1: (1) Legality principle: Data use activities involved in cooperation with partners must have legitimate purposes and comply with the legal basis of legitimacy. If the partner's use of information no longer complies with the legality principle, it should no longer use your personal information, or use it again after obtaining the corresponding cooperative basis.
section4_1_1_2: (2) Legitimacy and minimum necessity principle: Data use must have a legitimate purpose and should be limited to what is necessary to achieve the purpose.
section4_1_1_3: (3) Security and prudence principle: We will prudently evaluate the purpose of partners' use of data, comprehensively evaluate the security capabilities of these partners, and require them to follow cooperative legal agreements. We will strictly monitor the software development kits (SDKs) and application programming interfaces (APIs) through which partners obtain information to protect data security.
section4_1_2_1: For scenarios involving entrusted processing of personal information, we will sign relevant processing agreements with entrusted partners in accordance with legal provisions and supervise their personal information use activities.
section4_1_3_1: For scenarios involving joint processing of personal information, we will sign relevant agreements with partners in accordance with legal provisions and agree on their respective rights and obligations to ensure compliance with relevant legal provisions and protection of data security when using relevant personal information.
section4_1_4_1: If specific functions and scenarios involve services provided by our affiliates or third parties, the scope of partners includes our affiliates and third parties.
section4_2_title: Scenarios of joint processing or entrusted processing of personal information
section4_2_1: 2.1 Some specific modules or functions in platform and related service functions are provided by partners. You understand and agree that if we cooperate with any partner, we will only provide your personal information to them based on the principles of legality, legitimacy, and necessity, within the scope necessary to provide services, and we will strive to ensure that partners comply with this privacy policy and other appropriate confidentiality and security measures we require them to follow when using your information, promising not to use your information for any other purpose.
section4_2_2_title: 2.2 Data use for service security and statistical analysis
section4_2_2_1: (1) Ensure usage security: We attach great importance to account and service security. To protect the account and property security of you and other users, and to protect your and our legitimate rights and interests from infringement, we and our partners need to use necessary device, account, and log information.
section4_2_2_2: (2) Analyze service usage: To analyze the usage of our services and improve user experience, we and our partners need to use statistical data on your service usage (crashes, flashbacks). This data is difficult to combine with other information to identify your identity or associate it with your identity.
section4_2_3: 2.3 Payment functions are provided to you by third-party payment institutions cooperating with us. Third-party payment institutions will use your name, bank card type and number, expiration date, ID card number, and mobile phone number to provide functions. This information is necessary for payment functions. Refusing the above use will result in your inability to use this function, but it will not affect the normal use of other functions.
section4_3_1: We will not transfer your personal information to any other third party, except in the following circumstances:
section4_3_1_1: 3.1 Based on your written request and meeting the conditions specified by the national cyberspace administration, we will provide you with a transfer channel.
section4_3_1_2: 3.2 After obtaining your explicit consent, we will transfer your personal information to other third parties.
section4_3_1_3: 3.3 In the event of changes, mergers, acquisitions, or bankruptcy liquidation involving the platform's operating entity, if it involves the transfer of personal information, we will inform you of the relevant situation in accordance with the law, and require the new company or organization holding your information to continue to be bound by this privacy policy or continue to protect your information in accordance with security standards not lower than those required by this privacy policy. Otherwise, we will require that company or organization to re-obtain your authorization and consent. If bankruptcy occurs and there is no data successor, we will delete your information.
section4_4_1: 4.1 In principle, we will not publicly disclose your personal information unless we obtain your explicit consent or follow the disclosure required by national laws and regulations.
section4_4_1_1: (1) With your explicit consent or based on your active choice, we may publicly disclose your personal information;
section4_4_1_2: (2) To protect the personal and property safety of system users or the public from infringement, we may disclose information about you in accordance with applicable laws or system-related agreements and rules.
section4_4_2_title: 4.2 Exceptions to obtaining authorization and consent
section4_4_2_1: Please understand that in the following circumstances, in accordance with laws, regulations, and relevant national standards, we do not need to obtain your prior authorization and consent to collect and use your personal information:
section4_4_2_2: (1) Related to our fulfillment of obligations prescribed by laws and regulations;
section4_4_2_3: (2) Directly related to national security and national defense security;
section4_4_2_4: (3) Directly related to public safety, public health, and major public interests;
section4_4_2_5: (4) Directly related to criminal investigation, prosecution, trial, and execution of judgments;
section4_4_2_6: (5) Out of the need to protect the major legitimate rights and interests such as life and property of you or others, but it is difficult to obtain the consent of the person;
section4_4_2_7: (6) Personal information that you voluntarily disclose to the public;
section4_4_2_8: (7) Necessary for signing and performing contracts at the request of the personal information subject;
section4_4_2_9: (8) Your personal information collected from legally publicly disclosed information, such as legal news reports, government information disclosure, etc.;
section4_4_2_10: (9) Necessary for maintaining the safe and stable operation of software and related services, such as discovering and disposing of software and related service failures;
section4_4_2_11: (10) Necessary for conducting legal news reports;
section4_4_2_12: (11) Necessary for academic research institutions to conduct statistics or academic research based on public interests, and when providing academic research or descriptive results externally, de-identify the personal information contained in the results;
section4_4_2_13: (12) Other circumstances prescribed by laws and regulations.
section4_4_3: Please note that if information cannot identify your personal identity alone or in combination with other information, it does not belong to your personal information in the legal sense; when your information can identify your personal identity alone or in combination with other information, or when we combine data that cannot be linked to any specific personal information with your other personal information, these information will be treated and protected as your personal information in accordance with this privacy policy during the period of combined use.
section4_5_1: We may conduct product/service promotion with our partners. Partners conducting promotion or providing promotion services and related analysis services may need to use de-identified or anonymized device, tag, click, browse, display, and conversion data to achieve the aforementioned purposes, and may combine the above information with other data legally obtained by them to optimize promotion and delivery effects. We will require them to follow the principles of legality, legitimacy, and necessity in the use of information to protect users' legitimate rights from infringement.
section5_title: V. How we protect user information security
section5_1: 1. We attach great importance to the security of user information and will strive to take reasonable security measures (including technical and management aspects) to protect your information and prevent the information you provide from being improperly used or being accessed, publicly disclosed, used, modified, damaged, lost, or leaked without authorization.
section5_2: 2. We will use reasonable and feasible means such as encryption technology and anonymization processing not lower than industry standards to protect your information, and use security protection mechanisms to minimize the possibility of your information being maliciously attacked.
section5_3: 3. We will establish specialized security departments, security management systems, and data security processes to protect your information security. We adopt strict data use and access systems to ensure that only authorized personnel can access your information, and conduct security audits on data and technology in a timely manner in accordance with company-related internal management systems.
section5_4: 4. Although we have taken the above reasonable and effective measures and complied with the standards required by relevant legal provisions, please understand that due to technical limitations and possible malicious means, in the Internet industry, even if we do our best to strengthen security measures, we cannot always guarantee 100% information security. We will do our best to ensure the security of the information you provide to us. You know and understand that the systems and communication networks you use to access our services may have problems due to factors beyond our control. Therefore, we strongly recommend that you take positive measures to protect the security of user information, including but not limited to using complex passwords, changing passwords regularly, and not disclosing your account passwords and other information to others.
section5_5: 5. We will formulate emergency response plans and immediately activate emergency plans when user information security incidents occur, striving to prevent the impact and consequences of such security incidents from expanding. Once a user information security incident (leakage, loss, etc.) occurs, we will inform you in accordance with the requirements of laws and regulations: the basic situation and possible impact of the security incident, the disposal measures we have taken or will take, suggestions for you to independently prevent and reduce risks, and remedial measures for you. We will inform you of the relevant situation of the incident in the form of push notifications, emails, letters, or text messages. When it is difficult to inform individually, we will take reasonable and effective ways to issue announcements. At the same time, we will also report the disposal of user information security incidents to relevant regulatory authorities in accordance with requirements.
section5_6: We hereby specially remind you that the user information protection measures provided in this privacy policy only apply to the platform and related services. Once you leave the platform and related services and browse or use other websites, products, services, and content resources, we have no ability or obligation to protect any information you submit on software and websites outside the platform and related services, regardless of whether you log in, browse, or use the above software and websites based on links or guidance from the platform.
section6_1: 6.1 To recommend more relevant information and input instructions to you and provide services that better meet your requirements, we will provide you with personalized recommendation services.
section6_2: 6.2 When you keep the personalized recommendation switch on, we will collect and use your input information when using the product (including content preferences, dialogue content, and search text) and behavioral information (including your click, search, browse, and share operation records when accessing/using the product and feedback on our generated content) within the scope of your authorized consent. You can adjust your personal preferences at any time through "Settings - My Content Preferences".
section6_3: 6.3 If you do not wish to receive personalized recommendation content, you can contact us to turn off or on the personalized recommendation function. When you choose to turn off personalized recommendations, we will no longer display personalized recommendation content to you, and you will not be able to enjoy personalized recommendation services, but you can still continue to browse universal content unrelated to your preferences.
section7_1: We attach great importance to the management of personal information and will protect your rights to access, copy, correct, supplement, delete, withdraw authorization consent, cancel accounts, complain and report your information in accordance with the law, so that you have the ability to protect your privacy and information security.
section7_2_title: 1. Your rights in personal information processing activities
section7_2_1: You can cancel your account by contacting customer service. After cancellation, you will no longer be able to access system platform services and other services logged in through the account; if you only wish to cancel your service on the platform (i.e., delete all your developer data and user data on this platform and disable the platform service), you can contact us through the method disclosed in section 1.1. You know and understand that the aforementioned cancellation behavior is irreversible. When you cancel the platform service, we will stop providing any services to you and delete all information about your account or anonymize relevant information, except where laws and regulations require the retention of personal information. Your end users may not be able to access and use the Agent (intelligent agent), application, and workflow services you provide through platform technology. At the same time, you need to ensure that you have properly protected the rights and interests of the end users of your Agent (intelligent agent), application, and workflow, and properly handled or given up your paid rights and interests within the platform.
section7_3_title: Withdraw or change the scope of your authorized consent
section7_3_1: 3.1 You understand and agree that certain functions may require some basic personal information to be completed. In addition to the basic personal information collected to achieve business functions, for the collection and use of additional personal information, you can choose to withdraw your authorization or change the scope of your authorization. You can also withdraw all our authorization to continue collecting your personal information by canceling your account.
section7_3_2: 3.2 For the mobile client applications we provide, you can turn on or off relevant permissions in the device's settings function, change the scope of authorization or withdraw your authorization.
section7_3_3: 3.3 You understand and agree that when you withdraw consent or authorization, you will no longer be able to continue using the services corresponding to the withdrawn consent or authorization, and the platform will no longer process your corresponding personal information. However, your decision to withdraw consent or authorization will not affect the personal information processing previously carried out based on your authorization.
section7_4_title: How to obtain a copy of your personal information
section7_4_1: We will provide you with the following types of personal information copies based on your written request: your basic information and user identity information. However, please note that the information copy we provide to you is limited to the information we directly collect.
section7_5_1: In certain business functions, we may make decisions based solely on non-human automatic decision-making mechanisms such as information systems and algorithms. If these decisions significantly affect your legitimate rights and interests, you have the right to contact us through "official email" to provide feedback. We will also provide you with appropriate relief methods based on the actual situation, such as manually reviewing the results of autonomous decisions or terminating the use of automatic decision-making mechanisms to make relevant decisions.
section7_6_1: You can complain or report in accordance with our publicized system. If you believe that your information rights may be infringed, or if you discover clues infringing on your information rights, you can contact us by submitting relevant information and rights proof materials through "official email". We will provide timely feedback on your complaints and reports after verification.
section7_7_1: To ensure security, you may need to provide a written request and prove your identity in other ways. We may first ask you to verify your identity according to relevant rules before processing your request. If you are not satisfied with the response, you can also complain and report through the above channels.
section7_7_2: For your reasonable requests, we will not charge fees in principle. However, for repeated requests that exceed reasonable limits, we will charge certain costs depending on the specific situation. We may refuse requests that are unreasonably repeated, require excessive technical means (for example, requiring the development of new systems or fundamentally changing current practices), bring risks to the legitimate rights and interests of others, or are impractical (for example, involving information stored on backup tapes).
section7_7_3: You understand and acknowledge that in the following circumstances, we will be unable to respond to your requests:
section7_7_4: (1) Related to our fulfillment of obligations prescribed by laws and regulations
section7_7_5: (2) Directly related to national security and national defense security;
section7_7_6: (3) Directly related to public safety, public health, and major public interests;
section7_7_7: (4) Directly related to criminal investigation, prosecution, trial, and execution of judgments;
section7_7_8: (5) We have sufficient evidence to show that the personal information subject has subjective malice or abuses rights;
section7_7_9: (6) Out of the need to protect the major legitimate rights and interests such as life and property of the personal information subject or other individuals, but it is difficult to obtain the consent of the person;
section7_7_10: (7) Responding to the request of the personal information subject will cause serious damage to the legitimate rights and interests of the personal information subject or other individuals or organizations;
section7_8_1: If we cease operations, we will stop collecting your personal information and notify you of the cessation of operations in a commercially feasible form such as individual delivery or announcement, and delete or anonymize the personal information we hold about you.
section8_1: Our services are mainly oriented towards adults or enterprises. Without the consent of parents or guardians, minors (under the age of eighteen) should not create any account or use the platform and its services. If we discover that we have collected personal information of minors without first obtaining verifiable guardian consent, we will try to delete the relevant information as soon as possible.
section9_title: IX. Revision and notice of privacy policy
section9_1: 1. To provide you with better services, the platform and related services will be updated and changed from time to time. We will revise this privacy policy in a timely manner. Such revisions constitute part of this privacy policy and have the same effect as this privacy policy. However, without your explicit consent, we will not reduce the rights you should enjoy under the currently effective privacy policy.
section9_2: 2. After this privacy policy is updated, we will publish the updated version on the platform and remind you of the updated content through official website announcements or other appropriate methods before the updated terms take effect, so that you can understand the latest version of this privacy policy in a timely manner. If you continue to use the platform and related services, it will be deemed that you agree to accept all contents of this revised privacy policy.
section9_3: 3. For major changes, we will also provide more significant notices (including but not limited to email, text messages, system messages, or special prompts on the browsing page) to explain the specific changes to this privacy policy.
section9_4: 4. Major changes referred to in this privacy policy include but are not limited to:
section9_4_1: (1) Major changes in our service model. Such as the purpose of processing personal information, the type of personal information processed, the way personal information is used, etc.;
section9_4_2: (2) Major changes in our ownership structure, organizational structure, etc. Such as all changes caused by business adjustments, bankruptcy mergers and acquisitions, etc.;
section9_4_3: (3) Changes in the main objects of personal information transmission, transfer, or public disclosure;
section9_4_4: (4) Major changes in your rights in personal information processing and the way you exercise them;
section9_4_5: (5) When our contact information and complaint channels change.
section10_1: 1. This privacy policy applies to products, services, solutions provided by the platform, and other products, services, or solutions that the company may launch from time to time and include in the scope of services.
section10_2: 2. This privacy policy does not apply to products or services provided to you by third parties through the platform that have separate privacy policies and are not included in this privacy policy ("third-party services"). Your use of these third-party services (including any information including personal information you provide to these third parties) will be bound by the service terms and privacy policies of these third parties (rather than this privacy policy), and you can make relevant requests, complaints, and reports through the personal information subject request and complaint mechanisms established by them. For specific provisions, please carefully read the terms of the third party. Please properly protect your personal information and only provide it to third parties when necessary.
section10_3: 3. It needs to be specially explained that as a user of the platform, if you use the technical services of the platform to provide services to your users again, you should agree on a privacy policy with your users yourself. This privacy policy does not replace the privacy policy between you and your users.
section11_1: If you have any questions, comments, or suggestions about the content of this privacy policy, you can contact us through [official customer service]. Generally, we will reply within 15 days.
